info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN AUGLAIZE AND HARDIN COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 329 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Alger, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Ada, Forest, Dunkirk, Alger, Blanchard, Roundhead, Mcguffey, Patterson, Dola, Grant, Jumbo, Huntersville, Walton and State Route 195 at State Route 235. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
